item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: It is possible to get bits before then, I didn't say that. What I said is that there are no *specific* viruses that give them before then. Before then, the only things that give bits (unless the wiki page on "Fields" missed something) are the swarm of stray bits (12 bits), grove of AI flowers (25 bits) and the 50 bits that you get sometimes from doing the Climb a Tree action. But those are completely at random (well, other than the Climb a Tree, but you can't find that one every time). There are no specific difficulty ranges that are assured to get them. You *can* get bits…just not that many. Once you get to 110 difficulty, you can start getting 150, 250, even 750 bits in a single action. But before that, you luck out, and get the occasional 12-50 or so.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Depends on how early on you mean. Difficulty 110-130 fields have Corrupted Trees, for 250 bits (don't go over 130, cause in the 110-150, it adds in a 150-bit one). A bit later on, difficulty 150 fields have Blank Variables for 750 bits. Keep in mind that there's a random 0-5 difficulty modifier every day, so try to stay right at that level, so even if the day is +5 for that field, you won't hit the next difficulty bracket.

There's not really any fields that give bits, other than the 12/25-bit random events, and the possible 50 bits from Climb a Tree, before difficulty 110.

And as for the "advanced stuff", I meant I was asking if Doughman 3 can still be used for the upper-tier items at the bit shop. I would assume so, but then again, as far as I know, Good Boy lvl 3 no longer gives arena successes, so I try not to assume o_O
